ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Building Heritrix 0.8.0 from CVS with Maven, but without docs
ygData.msgSnippet: I cannot explain it Andy. I just did anonymous download of HEAD and built with rc1 and rc2 on a RH72. Straight checkout as me builds on debian. Tell me more

I cannot explain it Andy. 

I just did anonymous download of HEAD and built with rc1 and rc2 on a RH72.

Straight checkout as me builds on debian.

Tell me more about your environs.

Try a src distribution from here: 
http://crawltools.archive.org:8080/cruisecontrol/buildresults/ArchiveOpenCrawler

We had failures of the type below around the time of your first report.  
A cvs update showed new files coming down?

St.Ack


Andy Boyko wrote:

>Michael Stack wrote:
>  
>
>>(I just tested with maven rc2 and maven rc1 and the jar target works for 
>>both. I know that if you try to do any more than build jars, if you want 
>>to build the doc. or a distribution or generate the heritrix website, 
>>there'll be probs as has been reported on this list in the past.  Only 
>>HEAD works for sure with rc2).
>>    
>>
>
>Hmm... actually, on a clean CVS checkout and a "maven jar" I'm still 
>seeing the three tests fail that were failing last week (anything 
>relating to DiskBacked, and then the XMLSettingsHandler test).  I'm now 
>using Maven rc3, but they were failing with rc1 and rc2 too.  Last time 
>I mentioned it, you figured the HEAD was just broken, but that'd seem 
>not to be the case, given that 0.80 came out since we last talked about 
>it.  I've got to wager that it's *something* about my environment since 
>it's generally working, but it's doing so on two different machines, 
>with two different Linux distributions (same JDK, though - Sun 1.4.2_04).
>
>The stack trace is the same for all three tests (at least, in the 
>relevant parts):
>
>java.io.IOException: Invalid argument
>         at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.transferTo0(Native Method)
>         at

>         at 
>sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
>         at 
>sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
>         at 
>java.io.ObjectStreamClass.invokeWriteObject(ObjectStreamClass.java:809)

>java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeObject0(ObjectOutputStream.java:1052)
>         at 
>java.io.ObjectOutputStream.defaultWriteFields(ObjectOutputStream.java:1332)

>java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeSerialData(ObjectOutputStream.java:1304)

>java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeOrdinaryObject(ObjectOutputStream.java:1247)

>java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeObject0(ObjectOutputStream.java:1052)

>
>Any obvious guesses?  I've got no experience with the java.nio stuff, so 
>I assume it's all scary/broken/weird :)
